posts.post_content: works well with the other atogs. Expecially just [Atog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Atog) itself, if you use artifact creatures (the rest of them make it harder to sac creatures). then you sac a bunch of AC to Atog, then exile them with this guy. You wind up with 2 huge creatures ensted of 1. for the same price (assuming you have no other cards using the graveyard.)

posts.post_content:
You can work this into a spirit deck with  [Iname, Death Aspect](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Iname, Death Aspect )  and something making Necrotog unblockable.  
  
You mill yourself of all spirits in your deck and then he get's such a boost, he wrecks your opponent. Only problem would be a mill deck or a single counter.

posts.post_content: Did I hear "sideboard vs. a mill deck"? Seriously, just board out your removal and board in more dudes. Mill decks that aren't combo-y just die in like 5 turns. Because all they do is play lands. They don't play creatures or removal. They just play lands. Mill decks don't affect the board or your hand, so it's like you're playing solitaire as an aggro deck.
posts.html:
